intro: Alsine bipartita, commonly known as the two-lobed sandwort, is a low-growing annual plant native to sandy and coastal areas. It belongs to the family Montiaceae and is characterized by its small, succulent leaves and clusters of tiny white or pale pink flowers. The plant typically thrives in well-drained soils and is often found in dunes or disturbed sites. Its compact growth habit and ability to tolerate salt spray make it well adapted to harsh coastal environments. The species is also known for its ornamental value in horticulture due to its delicate appearance.
